title: Avengers: Endgame starts its Oscar campaign for Best Picture, Best Director and Best Screenplay
text:
Disney's Avengers: Endgame is currently the highest grossing movie of the year both domestically ($858.3 million) and globally ($2.796 billion), and now it's going for Oscar gold.

The studio has officially launched its awards season campaign for the superhero blockbuster with an official For Your Consideration website.

The website reveals the studio is putting Avengers: Endgame in contention for awards in 12 categories, but no acting consideration, even for MCU mainstay Robert Downey Jr. as Iron Man.

No acting awards: Disney is putting Avengers: Endgame in contention for awards in 12 categories, but no acting consideration, even for MCU mainstay Robert Downey Jr. as Iron Man

The studio will be vying for Best Picture for producer Kevin Feige, Best Director for brothers/filmmakers Anthony and Joe Russo and Best Adapted Screenplay for Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely.

While it's possible Marvel could add other categories for its awards campaign, it seems they're forgoing any consideration for the acting categories.

Given the emotional arc that Robert Downey Jr.'s Iron Man takes not only throughout the three-hour movie, but the 23-movie Marvel Cinematic Universe as a whole, some may be surprised that there is no awards push for Downey Jr.

Best Directors: The studio will be vying for Best Picture for producer Kevin Feige, Best Director for brothers/filmmakers Anthony and Joe Russo (above, at San Diego Comic-Con 2019) and Best Adapted Screenplay for Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely

Still, one reason could be because Avengers: Endgame features an immense ensemble cast, making it more difficult to single out specific performances.

Aside from the major awards, Avengers: Endgame will also be vying for Best Cinematography (Trent Opaloch), Best Production Design (Production Designer - Charles Wood, Set Designer - Tonja Schurmann) and Best Costume Design (Judianna Makovsky) and Best Original Score (Alan Silvestri).

The movie will also be vying for a number of technical awards, Best Sound Mixing (Tom Johnson, Juan Peralta, John Pritchett), Best Sound Editing (Shannon Mills, Daniel Laurie) and Best Visual Effects (Dan Deleeuw, Matt Aitken, Russel Earle, Dan Sudick).

Emotional: Given the emotional arc that Robert Downey Jr.'s Iron Man takes not only throughout the three-hour movie, but the 23-movie Marvel Cinematic Universe as a whole, some may be surprised that there is no awards push for Downey Jr

Avengers: Endgame shattered the opening weekend box office record when debuted with $357.1 million in late April.

That debut shattered the previous record of $257.6 million, set just one year prior by Endgame's predecessor, Avengers: Infinity War.

Endgame would go on to earn $2.789 billion worldwide, barely surpassing Avatar's $2.789 billion tally that was the highest worldwide gross for 10 years.

Box office hit: Avengers: Endgame shattered the opening weekend box office record when debuted with $357.1 million in late April

Disney also launched For Your Consideration websites for other 2019 hits such Aladdin, Toy Story 4, The Lion King and the upcoming Frozen 2.

Unlike the Avengers: Endgame website, the For Your Consideration sites for other sites doesn't reveal what specific awards each movie is up for.

Disney movies represent five of the six-highest grossing movies of 2019, with the other, Spider-Man: Far From Home, distributed by Sony but produced by Marvel.
